skillTree.localised_description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice â€“ a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
An Elder Shaggoth is big and strong enough to keep even the most hideous and untamable of creatures on check

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +6% for Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +8% for Monster units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: As they rarely awake, the pressence of an Elder Shaggoth attracts all manner of followers of Chaos and monsters alike who consider him the embodiment of the Will of the Dark Gods
Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Shaggoths that join Beastmen herds are brutal creatures that exist only to massacre and devour their opponents and will charge through a storm of bullets and cannonballs if needed.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against anything and everything

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Father of Plagues has happily embraced this one
As the diseases in his bloated and fetid body evidence, the generosity of Grandfather Nurgle is boundless, and his gifts, infinite
Such is the violence unleashed by this Shaggoth that even the Blood God looks him with approval.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against anything and everything
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against anything and everything
Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against anything and everything

skillTree.localised_description: The burning rage, unsatiable bloodthirst and eternally blood-drenched scales are surely the signs of KhorneÂ´s favor.
The Changer of Ways has identified this Shaggoth as a vital pawn in his new game and will protect him from enemy casters until the time to discard him comes
Sometimes, the gifts of Tzeentch are not visible but to those who can perceive the Winds of Magic

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Thousands of years surrounded by the pain and suffering of his victoms have made this Shaggoth appreciate the delights that only the Dark Prince can provide.
This DoombullÂ´s body is decorated with of trophies and jewellery from the multitude of victims he has tortured and maimed in the name of the Dark Prince.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Only destruction is left in the wake of the Doombull path.
The warp flows through this one, granting them powers beyond the mortal's dreams.
Unnatural mutations are a gift from the ruinous powers, keeping the Shaggoth in the fray for longer.
The Shaggoth never skips leg day.
The very presence of the Shaggoth makes its enemies feel weak at the knees. No wonder they can't seem to hit it.
The Shaggoth's thick skin is almost a second armor.
No matter how, the Shaggoth will always find a way to tear you apart.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against anything and everything
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against anything and everything
Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against anything and everything

skillTree.localised_description: The growing list of victories brings the attention of those immesurably more powerful.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
The desire to wreak havoc is innate, brought about not by choice but by sheer force of being.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
He who locks horns with this master of the warherd does so at his own peril.
The stench of raw, rotten meat causes others to balk, but the warherd revels in the flesh and brawn.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
More than leading a Warherd, Shaggoths just charge against all enemies they can find knowing other Beastmen will follow them as fast as they can

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Once a Shaggoth has taken control of a Warherd, only the strongest ungors and gors will be allowed to remain alive.

Melee attack: +3 for Ungors and Gors (Excluding Ranged)

Weapon Strength: +4% for melee Ungor and melee Gor units

skillTree.localised_description: Shaggoths know that most Beastmen are unable to understand complicated strategies, but some can still be used to flank and surround the enemy.

skillTree.localised_description: Shaggoths have a much better grasp of tactics than Beastmen and know that having some herds of shooters is useful when besieging a fortress or just to attract enemy fire.

Speed: +4% for Missile Ungor and Centigor units

skillTree.localised_description: Shaggoths use this creatures to harass and distract the enemy so the Beastmen warriors can reach their lines and begin the massacre.

Weapon Strength: +6 for Warhounds, Harpy, Feral Manticore, and Razorgor units

Speed: +2% for Warhounds, Harpies, Feral Manticore, and Razorgor units

Speed: +5% for Warhounds, Harpies, Feral Manticore, and Razorgor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of a Shaggoth pushes his best warriors -already extremely brutal and destructive by nature- to achieve even highest peaks of violence and wanton cruelty in the name of the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +3% for Bestigors and Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +4% for Bestigors and Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +10% for Bestigors and Minotaurs units

Weapon Strength: +10% for Bestigors and Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When a Shaggoth gathers the biggest and most savage monsters, they form an unstoppable wall of mutated flesh, horns and claws that can level entire cities.

effects.description:
Missile Strength: +4% for Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +5% for Cygor, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts, Jabberslythe, Chaos Spawn and Giant units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."
The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, Tzaangors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, Tzaangors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, Tzaangors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastmenâ€™s elite menagerie â€“ the brayherds â€“ slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Centigors of Tzeentch, Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, Feral Manticore and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement â€“ a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes) and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.
The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.
For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.
Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: A pungent mix of fell unguents ensures the unholy vitality of oneâ€™s minions.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.
Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can pass through trees.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: More than mere bloodlust, this one is filled with the primal, Ruinous rage of the Lord of Battle.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one has something of the compost heap about themâ€¦
The Dark Tongue is an apt medium through which to torment, mock and enrage the foe.
Sometimes, letting so much blood that the soil itself is stained just isn't enough. And it will never be.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Minotaur units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
